body_html:
I just tried building and installing from head. The only difference is that I built a CPU-only package.

python3 -m venv venv/
source venv/bin/activate

git clone https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow.git
cd tensorflow

pip install keras_applications==1.0.4
pip install keras_preprocessing==1.0.2
pip install --upgrade six mock portpicker scipy sklearn grpcio
pip install numpy==1.14.5
pip install h5py==2.8.0

# Here I picked default for everything
./configure

bazel build --config=opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package

Move out of tensorflow directory before installing tensorflow pip package.
cd ..
pip install /tmp/tensorflow_pkg/tensorflow-1.11.0rc1-cp35-cp35m-linux_x86_64.whl

"from tensorflow import keras" worked fine after this step. I don't know if we want to support this type of import long term, however.
I might try GPU build later today, but for now you can check if anything is missing.

Edit: fixed formatting

body:
I just tried building and installing from head. The only difference is that I built a CPU-only package.
```
python3 -m venv venv/
source venv/bin/activate

git clone https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow.git
cd tensorflow

pip install keras_applications==1.0.4
pip install keras_preprocessing==1.0.2
pip install --upgrade six mock portpicker scipy sklearn grpcio
pip install numpy==1.14.5
pip install h5py==2.8.0

# Here I picked default for everything
./configure

bazel build --config=opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package

Move out of tensorflow directory before installing tensorflow pip package.
cd ..
pip install /tmp/tensorflow_pkg/tensorflow-1.11.0rc1-cp35-cp35m-linux_x86_64.whl
```
"from tensorflow import keras" worked fine after this step. I don't know if we want to support this type of import long term, however.
I might try GPU build later today, but for now you can check if anything is missing.

Edit: fixed formatting
